intro: Chionochloa rubra subsp. rubra, commonly known as the red mountain grass, is a perennial grass species native to New Zealand. It is characterized by its tufted growth habit and slender, reddish stems that often display a striking coloration. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences with pale green to brown flowers, typical of the Poaceae family. It thrives in alpine and subalpine environments, often growing in rocky or gravelly soils at high elevations. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation areas.
